intro: Oligoneuron jacksonii, commonly known as Jackson's oligoneuron, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, woolly leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
